title: How to Make an Orange and Honey Drink

steps.headline: Choose whether you are going to make just a mug, or a whole flask.
steps.description: Fill your chosen vessel with orange juice.

steps.headline: If your orange juice has pulp bits in it,  try sieving them out.
steps.description: However much you may enjoy cold orange with pulp, it is always nicer to be rid of it in a hot drink.

steps.headline: Pour into a pan.
steps.description: Place on hob/aga/cooker/stove. Turn up the heat to quite high.

steps.headline: Optional: Add some water.
steps.description: For normal drinking, try this step. However, if you have a singing competition, or a particularly bad throat, you may prefer the more concentrated version.

steps.headline: When it is pretty hot, add some honey.
steps.description: Stir until dissolved. Taste. Add more if you want it sweeter. Continue until perfect.

steps.headline: By now you should have very hot orange juice, but don't let it boil.
steps.description: Once it is quite near boiling, probably just hotter than drinkable, pour it into your flask/mug/cup.

text: Choose whether you are going to make just a mug, or a whole flask. Fill your chosen vessel with orange juice. If your orange juice has pulp bits in it,  try sieving them out. However much you may enjoy cold orange with pulp, it is always nicer to be rid of it in a hot drink. Pour into a pan. Place on hob/aga/cooker/stove. Turn up the heat to quite high. Optional: Add some water. For normal drinking, try this step. However, if you have a singing competition, or a particularly bad throat, you may prefer the more concentrated version. When it is pretty hot, add some honey. Stir until dissolved. Taste. Add more if you want it sweeter. Continue until perfect. By now you should have very hot orange juice, but don't let it boil. Once it is quite near boiling, probably just hotter than drinkable, pour it into your flask/mug/cup. Enjoy!
